Evidence: Required in erastin-induced ferroptosis.

Name: Phosphatidylinositol-4,5-bisphosphate 3-kinase catalytic subunit alpha
Evidence: Inhibitor blocked ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: Cell survival assays
Pathway: PIK3CA :-: GSH, GSH :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis
Caution: Also involved in necrosis and apoptosis.

Name: Fms related tyrosine kinase 3
Evidence: Inhibitor blocked ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: Cell survival assays
Pathway: FLT3 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis
Caution: Also involved in necrosis and apoptosis.

Name: Sterol carrier protein 2
Evidence: SCP-2 inhibitors showed anti-ferroptotic activity, which was substantiated by knocking down SCP-2 in Gpx4−/− cells.
Test method: Cell viability test, siRNA-mediated knockdown.
Caution: Transient effect. Other translocases may work in parallel.

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: Inhibits cystine uptake and sensitizes cells to ferroptosis. Erastin induced high levels of cell death in p53+/+ MEFs.
Test method: Cell death kinetics, shRNA, western blotting, RT-PCR, ChIP assay, cystine uptake assay
Test setting: H1299, U2OS and MCF7 cells, mouse embryonic fibroblasts
Pathway: TP53 :-: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :+: Cystine, Cystine :-: Ferroptosis
Caution: The acetylation-defective mutant (p53[3KR]) also retains the ability to induce ferroptosis upon reactive oxygen species (ROS)-induced stress.

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Deletion of this gene likely suppress ferroptosis by limiting the membrane-resident pool of oxidation-sensitive fatty acids.
Test method: Retroviral-mediated insertional mutagenesis and sequencing
Test setting: Chronic myeloid leukemia cell line KBM7
Caution: Author prediction based on gene function.

Name: Lysophosphatidylcholine acyltransferase 3
Evidence: Deletion of this gene likely suppress ferroptosis by limiting the membrane-resident pool of oxidation-sensitive fatty acids.
Test method: Retroviral-mediated insertional mutagenesis and sequencing
Test setting: Chronic myeloid leukemia cell line KBM7
Caution: Author prediction based on gene function.

Name: NRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase
Evidence: NRAS12V mutant protects RMS13 cells from ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: Cell viability assessed by MTT assay, western blot
Caution: Inferred as a promoter because RAS mutant is resistant to ferroptosis.

Name: KRAS proto-oncogene, GTPase
Evidence: KRAS12V mutant protects RMS13 cells from ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: Cell viability assessed by MTT assay, western blot
Caution: Inferred as a promoter because RAS mutant is resistant to ferroptosis.

Name: HRas proto-oncogene, GTPase
Evidence: HRAS12V mutant protects RMS13 cells from ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: Cell viability assessed by MTT assay, western blot
Caution: Inferred as a promoter because RAS mutant is resistant to ferroptosis.

Name: Transferrin
Evidence: Essential for the induction of ferroptotic cell death. Transferrin can only interact with transferrin receptor and be transported into the cell when it is loaded with iron.
Test method: Killing activity

Name: Transferrin receptor
Evidence: RNAi of transferrin receptor (TfR) inhibited ferroptosis.
Test method: RNAi

Name: Transferrin receptor 2
Evidence: RNAi of transferrin receptor (TfR) inhibited ferroptosis.
Test method: RNAi

Name: Solute carrier family 38 member 1
Evidence: RNAi knockdown markedly blocked ferroptosis.
Test method: RNAi knockdown, cell survival analysis
Pathway: SLC38A1 :+: Glutamine, Glutamine :+: Glutamate, Glutamate :+: alpha-Ketoglutarate, alpha-Ketoglutarate :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Solute carrier family 1 member 5
Evidence: Pharmacological inhibition by L-g-glutamyl-p-nitroanilide or RNAi knockdown markedly blocked ferroptosis.
Test method: RNAi knockdown, cell survival analysis
Pathway: SLC1A5 :+: Glutamine, Glutamine :+: Glutamate, Glutamate :+: alpha-Ketoglutarate, alpha-Ketoglutarate :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Glutaminase 2
Evidence: Both inhibitor inhibition and gene knockdown inhibit ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: shRNA, western blot, cell viability

Name: Glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase 1
Evidence: RNAi reduced ferroptosis.
Test method: shRNA, qPCR, cell viability

Name: Cysteinyl-tRNA synthetase 1
Evidence: Required for ferroptosis in diverse cell contexts. Knockdown of CARS inhibited erastin-induced death by preventing the induction of lipid reactive oxygen species, without altering iron homeostasis.
Test method: siRNA screen, shRNA, western blot, cell viability
Test setting: HT-1080 fibrosarcoma cells,BJeLR fibroblast cells, Panc1 cells, A673 (Ewing’s sarcoma) and 143B (osteosarcoma) cells, PC12 cells
Pathway: CARS1 :-: Transsulfuration pathway, Transsulfuration pathway :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: Wild type p53 can induce ferroptosis upon reactive oxygen species (ROS)-induced stress.
Test method: Cell death quantification, western blot

Name: Arachidonate 5-lipoxygenase
Evidence: The 5-Lipoxygenase inhibitor zileuton protected HT22 neuronal cells from erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell Viability Assay, ROS measurement
Pathway: ALOX5 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Kelch like ECH associated protein 1
Evidence: Knockdown of Keap1 reversed loss of p62-increased degradation of NRF2 in ferroptosis. Keap1 knockdown led to resistance to erastin-induced and sorafenib-induced growth inhibition with decreased ferroptotic events in the absence or presence of p62 knockdown.
Test method: Western blot, shRNA knockdown, cell viability
Test setting: HepG2, Hepa1‐6, Hep3B, and SNU‐182 cells

Name: Heme oxygenase 1
Evidence: Zinc protoporphyrin IX, a HO-1 inhibitor, prevented Erastin-triggered ferroptotic cancer cell death. Overexpression accelerates erastin-induced cell death.
Test method: Cell viability assay, qRT-PCR, western blot
Test setting: HT-1080 fibrosarcoma cells, mice lung fibroblastic cells
Pathway: HMOX1 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis
Caution: Other articles (PMID 26403645, 28515173) suggest it a suppressor.

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: p53^3KR/3KR Xrcc4^-/- MEF cells are very sensitive to ferroptosis. Stabilized in the spleens of p53^3KR/3KR Xrcc4^-/- mice which enables to prevent the development of pro-B-cell lymphomas.
Test method: Western blot, qRT-PCR, cell viability
Test setting: p53^3KR/3KR Xrcc4^-/- MEF cells, p53^3KR/3KR Xrcc4^-/- mice

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: Incubation with erastin led to profound cell death in wild-type MEFs.
Test method: Cell viability assay, phase-contrast microscopy
Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts, lymphoblastoid cell lines

Name: Glutaminase 2
Evidence: Upregulated in erastin-treated wild-type MEFs, and silencing Gls2 exihibits cell death defect in wild-type MEFs treated with erastin.
Test method: Cell viability assay,western blot

Name: Autophagy related 5
Evidence: Knockout or knockdown limited erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: shRNA
Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts, human pancreatic cancer cell lines (PANC1 and PANC2.03), and the human fibrosarcoma cell line HT-1080

Name: Autophagy related 7
Evidence: Knockout or knockdown limited erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: shRNA
Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts, human pancreatic cancer cell lines (PANC1 and PANC2.03), and the human fibrosarcoma cell line HT-1081

Name: Nuclear receptor coactivator 4
Evidence: Inhibition suppressed ferroptosis, and overexpression promoted ferroptosis.
Test method: shRNA, gene transfection

Name: Transferrin
Evidence: Involved in siramesine and lapatinib-induced ferroptotic cell death. Increased following treatment with lapatinib alone or in combination with siramesine. Knocking down of transferrin resulted in decreased cell death and ROS after treatment.
Test method: Western blot, densitometry quantification, siRNA, gene transfection, cell death test
Pathway: TF :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Arachidonate 5-lipoxygenase
Evidence: Silencing ALOX genes made cells resistant to ferroptosis.
Test method: qPCR
Pathway: ALOX5 :+: PUFAs peroxidation, PUFAs peroxidation :+: Ferroptosis

Evidence: Silencing ALOX genes made cells resistant to ferroptosis.

Evidence: Silencing ALOX genes made cells resistant to ferroptosis.

Name: Arachidonate 15-lipoxygenase type B
Evidence: Silencing ALOX genes made cells resistant to ferroptosis. Erastin-induced cell death was rescued by silencing either ALOX15B or ALOXE3, which supported the hypothesis that lipoxygenases are required for ferroptosis.

Pathway: ALOX15B :+: PUFAs peroxidation, PUFAs peroxidation :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Arachidonate lipoxygenase 3
Evidence: Silencing ALOX genes made cells resistant to ferroptosis. Erastin-induced cell death was rescued by silencing either ALOX15B or ALOXE3, which supported the hypothesis that lipoxygenases are required for ferroptosis.

Pathway: ALOXE3 :+: PUFAs peroxidation, PUFAs peroxidation :+: Ferroptosis

Pathway: PHKG2 :+: PUFAs peroxidation, PUFAs peroxidation :+: Ferroptosis
Protein encoded: Phosphorylase b kinase gamma catalytic chain

Evidence: Elimination of NCOA4 expression by RNAi knockdown significantly block ferroptosis

Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts and HT1080 cells
Pathway: NCOA4 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Knockdown inhibited erastin-induced ferroptosis, whereas overexpression restored ferroptosis sensitization.
Test method: shRNA, gene transfection, western blot
Test setting: LNCaP (human prostate cancer cells), K562 (human erythromyeloblastoid leukemia cell line), HepG2 (human hepatocellular cells), and HL60 (human promyelocytic leukemia cells)

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: p53 acetylation has a critical role in ferroptotic responses. Simultaneous loss of K98/117/161/162 acetylations is unable to induce ferroptosis, and its ability to thwart cancer growth is also abrogated.
Test method: Mass spectrometry screening, western blot, cell death assay

Name: Spermidine/spermine N1-acetyltransferase 1
Evidence: p53-mediated activation of SAT1 contributes to ferroptotic cell death in the presence of ROS stress. Knockdown of Sat1 partially rescued ROS-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: qRT-PCR, siRNA, CRISPR-cas9, western blot
Test setting: H1299, U2OS cells, mouse embryonic fibroblasts, mouse xenograft
Pathway: SAT1 :+: ALOX15, ALOX15 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Arachidonate 15-lipoxygenase
Evidence: SAT1- and ROS-induced ferroptosis was completely abrogated by PD146176, an ALOX15-specific inhibitor.
Test method: Cell death count, qRT-PCR, siRNA
Pathway: ALOX15 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Inhibition of ACSL4 was effective in protecting against RSL3-induced cell death. Acsl4 KO cells are resistant to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell death count, LC-MS/MS,  fluorescence imaging

Name: Lysophosphatidylcholine acyltransferase 3
Evidence: Knockdown of Lpcat3 increased resistance to ferroptosis triggered by RSL3.
Test method: shRNA
Test setting: Mouse lung epithelial (MLE) and embryonic cells

Name: Arachidonate 15-lipoxygenase
Evidence: Liproxstatin-1 inhibited the 15-LOX enzymatic activity and suppressed ferroptosis.
Test method: Identification of oxygenated PE

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: An essential proferroptotic gene. Re-expression of Flag-tagged human wild-type (WT) ACSL4 (ACSL4-Flag) in Acsl4 KO Pfa1 cells restored full sensitivity to ferroptosis induction. Inhibition showed significantly prolonged survival compared to vehicle-treated mice.
Test method: Cell viability, immunoblot,  lipid peroxidation assessment, CRISPR–Cas9, qPCR, microarray, RNA-seq
Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts (Pfa1 cells), human breast cancer cell lines, Gpx4 KO mice

Name: Kelch like ECH associated protein 1
Evidence: Keap 1 silencing decreased ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability assay, western blot, siRNA
Test setting: Head and neck cancer cells, nude mice

Name: Epidermal growth factor receptor
Evidence: Cell death in activated EGFR mutant cells occurs by ferroptosis. Inhibiting EGFR and MAPK signaling rescued cell viability following cystine withdrawal.
Test method: Fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) analysis, cell viability

Name: NADPH oxidase 4
Evidence: Inhibition of NADPH oxidase 4 (NOX4) blocked ferroptosis.
Test method: Fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) analysis, cell viability
Pathway: NOX4 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 3
Evidence: Inhibiting EGFR and MAPK signaling rescued cell viability following cystine withdrawal.
Test method: Immunoblots, lucifer yellow infiltration, cell viability, fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) analysis
Pathway: MAPK :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Lipid ROS, MAPK :+: NOX4, NOX4 :+: H2O2, H2O2 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 1
Evidence: Inhibiting EGFR and MAPK signaling rescued cell viability following cystine withdrawal.
Test method: Immunoblots, lucifer yellow infiltration, cell viability, fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) analysis
Pathway: MAPK :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Lipid ROS, MAPK :+: NOX4, NOX4 :+: H2O2, H2O2 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: BH3 interacting domain death agonist
Evidence: BID deletion prevents erastin- and glutamate-induced cell death. BID inhibition inhibited erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability, western blot, CRISPR/Cas9, gene transfection

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Knockout of Acsl4 in ferroptosis-sensitive cells conferred protection from erastin- and RSL3-induced cell death.
Test method: CRISPR/Cas9, western blotting, cell death assessment
Test setting: NIH3T3, HT-29, HT-1080 and L929 cells

Name: Zinc finger E-box binding homeobox 1
Evidence: Knockout of ZEB1 prevents cell death induced by GPX4 inhibition.
Test method: sgRNA, cell viability
Pathway: ZEB1 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Kelch like ECH associated protein 1
Evidence: Keap1 inhibition promotes resistance to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability analysis

Name: Dipeptidyl peptidase 4
Evidence: Required for ferroptosis in TP53-deficient CRC cells.
Test method: Cell death, RNAi, western blot, enzyme activity
Test setting: TP53-/- HCT116 cells, athymic nude mice
Pathway: DPP4 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Arachidonate 15-lipoxygenase
Evidence: Suppression of ferroptosis following ALOX15 silencing was detected in cancer cells. Cells with exogenous expression of ALOX15 had an increased cell death rate following RSL3 treatment.
Test method: siRNA, transfection, western blot, cellular lipoxygenase assay

Name: Arachidonate 12-lipoxygenase, 12S type
Evidence: 12‐LOX inhibitors prevented cell death, whereas ALOX12 overexpression significantly enhanced cell death. ALOX12 expression was gradually elevated during the erastin or RSL3 treatments, and was stable in the late stage of ferroptosis.
Test method: siRNA, transfection, western blot, cellular lipoxygenase assay

Name: Cyclin dependent kinase inhibitor 2A
Evidence: Combination of ARF induction and ROS treatment induced ferroptotic cell death. Knockdown of endogenous ARF protected cells from ROS-induced cell death.
Test method: RNAi, immunoblot, phase-contrast image, cell death quantification
Test setting: H1299, SaoS2, U2OS cells, mouse embryonic fibroblasts
Pathway: CDKN2A :-: NFE2L2, NFE2L2 :+: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :-: Ferroptosis, CDKN2A :+: p53, p53 :-: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Phosphatidylethanolamine binding protein 1
Evidence: Elevated levels of PEBP1 resulted in increased sensitivity of HK2 cells to RSL3 whereas lowered contents of PEBP1 in HAEC and HT22 cells were associated with decreased sensitivity to ferroptosis.
Test method: Western blot, siRNA, cell death assay

Name: Suppressor of cytokine signaling 1
Evidence: Expression of SOCS1 sensitized cells to ferroptosis inducer. This effect of SOCS1 was efficiently blocked by ferroptosis inhibitor. Expression of SOCS1 reduced the levels of GSH, explaining in part its ability to sensitize cells to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell death assay, cell viability assay, qPCR
Pathway: SOCS1 :+: p53, p53 :-: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :+: GSH, GSH :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Cysteine dioxygenase type 1
Evidence: CDO1 suppression contributes to ferroptosis resistance.
Test method: siRNA, western blot, MTT assay
Test setting: Gastric cancer cells AGS, BGC823, athymic nude mice

Name: MYB proto-oncogene, transcription factor
Evidence: Erastin-induced ferroptosis was restrained when c-Myb was suppressed.
Test method: Western blot, siRNA, qRT-PCR, MTT assay
Test setting: Gastric cancer cells AGS, BGC823, MKN45, SGC7901, and MGC803
Pathway: MYB :+: CDO1, CDO1 :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Heme oxygenase 1
Evidence: Inhibiting HO-1 effectively attenuated BAY-induced ferroptotic cell death. Defective HO-1 expression significantly rescued cell survival suppressed by BAY.
Test method: Cell viability assay, qRT-PCR, shRNA, gene overexpression, western blot

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 8
Evidence: JNK1/2 inhibitors inhibited t-BHP-induced ferroptosis. t-BHP treatment significantly increased the protein expression of p-JNK.
Test method: MitoSOX probe, luminometer kit, C11-BODIPY probe, western blot
Pathway: MAPK8 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 9
Evidence: JNK1/2 inhibitors inhibited t-BHP-induced ferroptosis. t-BHP treatment significantly increased the protein expression of p-JNK.
Test method: MitoSOX probe, luminometer kit, C11-BODIPY probe, western blot
Pathway: MAPK9 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 1
Evidence: ERK1/2 inhibitors inhibited t-BHP-induced ferroptosis. t-BHP treatment significantly increased the protein expression of p-ERK.
Test method: MitoSOX probe, luminometer kit, C11-BODIPY probe, western blot
Pathway: MAPK1 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 3
Evidence: ERK1/2 inhibitors inhibited t-BHP-induced ferroptosis. t-BHP treatment significantly increased the protein expression of p-ERK.
Test method: MitoSOX probe, luminometer kit, C11-BODIPY probe, western blot
Pathway: MAPK3 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Solute carrier family 1 member 5
Evidence: Overexpression of SLC1A5 restored miR-137-mediated ferroptosis suppression.
Test method: Cell viability assay, lipid ROS assay, western blot, gene overexpression, shRNA
Test setting: Melanoma cell lines A375 and G-361
Pathway: SLC1A5 :+: Glutaminolysis, Glutaminolysis :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: ChaC glutathione specific gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase 1
Evidence: CHAC1 degradation of GSH might enhance cystine-starvation-induced cell death.
Test method: Western blot, real-time PCR, cell viability assay, siRNA, GSH assay kit

Name: Mitogen-activated protein kinase 14
Evidence: Ferroptosis was blocked by inhibiting p38 MAPK activation.
Test method: Cell viability assay, lipid ROS measurement, RT-qPCR, western blot

Name: Long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 472
Evidence: Increases erastin-induced growth inhibition, whereas depletion of P53RRA decreased erastin-induced growth inhibition.
Test method: Bisulfite sequencing, RNA pull-down, mass spectrometry, RNA immunoprecipitation, qRT-PCR, cell viability assay
Test setting: Lung cancer A549, SPCA1, and H522 cells
Protein encoded: Putative uncharacterized protein encoded by LINC00472

Name: NADPH oxidase 4
Evidence: Activated  Nox4  contributes to  PAB-induced  ferroptotic cell death. knockdown made cells resistant to PAB-induced death.
Test method: Western blot, LDH release assay, siRNA, cell death, siRNA
Test setting: Rat C6, human SHG-44, U87 and U251 glioma cells
Pathway: NOX4 :+: H2O2, H2O2 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase 1
Evidence: Overexpression of miR‐9 suppressed GOT1, which subsequently reduced ferroptosis. Overexpression of GOT1 restored miR‐9 mediated ferroptosis suppression.
Test method: Immunoblotting, luciferase reporter assay, qPCR, cell viability assay, MDA assay, iron assay, glutamate assay
Pathway: GOT1 :+: alpha KG, alpha KG :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Beclin 1
Evidence: Knockdown inhibits ferroptosis. Overexpression increases ferroptotic cancer cell death.
Test method: shRNA, western blot, cell viability assay, gene overexpression
Test setting: HCT116, CX-1, PANC1, HT1080, and Calu-1 cells, athymic nude immunodeficient mice
Pathway: BECN1 :-: System Xc-, System Xc- :+: GSH, GSH :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Protein kinase AMP-activated catalytic subunit alpha 2
Evidence: Inhibition of PRKAA/AMPKalpha diminishes ferroptosis.
Test method: siRNA, western blot, cell viability assay, GSH assay, lipid peroxidation assay, iron assay

Name: Protein kinase AMP-activated catalytic subunit alpha 1
Evidence: Inhibition of PRKAA/AMPKalpha diminishes ferroptosis.
Test method: siRNA, western blot, cell viability assay, GSH assay, lipid peroxidation assay, iron assay

Name: ELAV like RNA binding protein 1
Evidence: ELAVL1 siRNA led to ferroptosis resistance, whereas ELAVL1 plasmid contributed to classical ferroptotic events.
Test method: Immunohistochemistry, hydroxyproline assay, immunofluorescence, cell viability assay, western blot, qPCR, iron assay, ROS assay, RNAi
Test setting: Human liver specimens and hepatic stellate cell; C57BL/6 mice; mouse hepatocyte and hepatic stellate cell; HSC-LX2 and HSC-T6 cells

Name: BRCA1 associated protein 1
Evidence: Suppresses SLC7A11-mediated cystine uptake and promotes ferroptosis. BAP1 mutants lose their abilities to repress SLC7A11 and to promote ferroptosis.
Test method: Flow cytometry, cell viability assay, cell death assay, western blot, gene knockout, lipid peroxidation assay, cystine uptake assay, GSH assay, RT-PCR, ChIP-qPCR, luciferase reporter assay, immunoprecipitation, IHC, ChIP-seq
Test setting: HEK-293T, Caki1, 786-O, 769-P, ACHN and NCI-H226 cell lines; RCC4,  UMRC2, SLR20, and UMRC6 cell lines; TK10 cell line; athymic nude mice
Pathway: BAP1 :-: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Tumor protein p53
Evidence: Facilitates ART-induced ferroptosis. Conversely, knockdown of P53 blocked ART-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Western blot, immunofluorescence, siRNA

Name: ATP binding cassette subfamily C member 1
Evidence: Accelerates ferroptosis. Disruption of MRP1 inhibited ferroptosis potently.
Test method: Western blot, GSH assay, dead cell counts, gene transfection, CRISPR/Cas9, cell viability assay, RT-qPCR

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Inhibition suppresses ferroptosis.
Test method: siRNA, western blot, microscopy imaging, fluorescence microscopy, real-time PCR
Pathway: ACSL4 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: microRNA 6852
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis. Binds to LINC0033 and serves as a negative upstream regulator of CBS-mediated ferroptosis inhibition.
Test method: qRT-PCR, gene knockdown, luciferase assay, gene overexpression, MTT assay, colony-formation assay

Name: Activin A receptor type 1B
Evidence: Inhibition attenuated erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Western blot, siRNA, glutathione assay, RT-PCR, cell viability assay

Name: Transforming growth factor beta receptor 1
Evidence: Inhibition attenuated erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Western blot, siRNA, glutathione assay, RT-PCR, cell viability assay

Name: BRCA1 associated protein 1
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis induced by class I ferroptosis inducer.
Test method: Immunoprecipitation, western blotting, cell death, cell viability, RT-PCR

Name: Endothelial PAS domain protein 1
Evidence: A driver of ferroptosis susceptibility. Ablation reduced susceptibility to ferroptosis.
Test method: CRISPR, sgRNA, shRNA, immunoblot, cell viability, western blot
Pathway: EPAS1 :+: HILPDA, EPAS1 :+: PLIN2, HILPDA :+: PUFA, PLIN2 :+: PUFA, PUFA :+: PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides, PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Hypoxia inducible lipid droplet associated
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis sensitivity downstream of HIF-2alpha.
Test method: RNA-Seq, western blot, qRT-PCR, shRNA, cell viability, immunoblot
Pathway: HILPDA :+: PUFA, PUFA :+: PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides, PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Hypoxia inducible factor 1 subunit alpha
Evidence: Re-sensitized HIF-2alpha-null cells to ferroptosis.  Induce ferroptosis sensitivity in cancer cells.
Test method: cDNA screenin, cell viability
Pathway: HIF1A :+: HILPDA, HIF1A :+: PLIN2, HILPDA :+: PUFA, PLIN2 :+: PUFA, PUFA :+: PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides, PUFA-phospholipid hydroperoxides :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Arachidonate 12-lipoxygenase, 12S type
Evidence: An essential factor of p53-dependent ferroptosis. Loss of one Alox12 allele is sufficient to abrogate p53-mediated ferroptosis.
Test method: RNAi, qRT-PCR, western blot, CRISPR, cell death assay, GSH measurement, flow cytometer
Test setting: H1299 cells, U2OS cells, mouse embryonic fibroblasts, mice

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Required for ferroptosis induced by erastin. ACSL4-null cells are resistant to ferroptosis induced by either erastin.
Test method: Western blot, cell death assay, CRISPR

Name: Heme oxygenase 1
Evidence: Enhances the ferroptotic process in PRDX6-silenced cells by promoting cellular accumulation of ferrous ions. Overexpression increases both erastin and RSL-3-induced lipid ROS.
Test method: Gene transfection, western blot, qRT-PCR, LOOH quantification

Name: Interferon gamma
Evidence: Interferon gamma released from CD8+ T cells downregulates the expression of SLC3A2 and SLC7A11, and as a consequence, promotes tumour cell lipid peroxidation and ferroptosis.
Test method: BODIPY-C11, liperfluo staining, cell death measurement, FACS, cell proliferation and viability assay, qPCR, immunoblotting, glutathione quantification, MDA assay, glutamate assay
Test setting: HT-1080, A375, B16-F0, ID8 cells, female NSG and C57BL/6 mice
Pathway: IFNG :-: SLC3A2, IFNG :-: SLC7A11, SLC3A2 :+: System Xc-, SLC7A11 :+: System Xc-, System Xc- :+: Cystine, Cystine :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Anoctamin 6
Evidence: Essential for ferroptosis. Inhibition blocked ferroptotic cell death induced by RSL3/erastin.
Test method: Immunocytochemistry, RT-PCR, TUNEL Assay, flow Cytometry, LDH assay, gene knockout, siRNA
Test setting: A549, Cal27, HT29 and MG-63 cells, Cx3cr1-Cre mice

Name: Lipin 1
Evidence: Overexpression of adipose lipin‐1 in mice facilitated the onset of hepatic ferroptosis.
Test method: Enzyme‐linked immunosorbent assay, lipid peroxidation assay, iron assay, MDA assay, qPCR, GSH assay

Name: High mobility group box 1
Evidence: Required for erastin-induced ferroptosis. Knockdown of HMGB1 decreased erastin-induced cell death.
Test method: Gene transfection, RNAi, cell viability assay, ELISA, LDH assay, flow cytometry, qPCR, western blot, electron microscopy

Name: TNF alpha induced protein 3
Evidence: Overexpression increased ROS generation and enhanced erastin-induced ferroptosis, whereas knockdown inhibited erastin-induced ferroptosis.
Test method: Lentivirus transduction, CCK-8 assay, DYE670 staining assay, ROS staining assay, RT-qPCR, western blot
Pathway: TNFAIP3 :+: ACSL4, ACSL4 :+: Lipid ROS, TNFAIP3 :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Toll like receptor 4
Evidence: Knockdown inhibited ferroptosis.
Test method: Immunohistochemistry, western blot, cell death assay, siRNA

Name: NADPH oxidase 4
Evidence: Knockdown inhibited ferroptosis.
Test method: Immunohistochemistry, western blot, cell death assay, siRNA

Name: Activating transcription factor 3
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis induced by erastin.
Test method: Cell viability assay, transfection, lentiviral infection, qRT-PCR, western blot
Test setting: HT1080 cells, retinal pigment epithelial cells
Pathway: ATF3 :-: SLC7A11, SLC7A11 :+: System Xc-, System Xc- :+: GSH, GSH :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: ATM serine/threonine kinase
Evidence: Essential for ferroptosis. Genetic knockdown and chemical inhibition of ATM both suppress ferroptotic cell death.
Test method: siRNA, western blot, nuclear/cytosol fraction, cell viability, cell death, GSH assay, kinome screen, qRT-PCR, immunofluorescence assay
Test setting: MDA-MB-231, RCC4, 293T, and HT-1080 cell lines
Pathway: ATM :-: MTF1, MTF1 :+: FTL, MTF1 :+: FTH1, FTL :-: Ferroptosis, FTH1 :-: Ferroptosis

Name: YY1 associated protein 1
Evidence: Makes cells more sensitive to ferroptosis. Cells lacking YAP were no longer sensitised to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell death, cell viability, lipid peroxidation, immunoblotting, CRISPR/Cas9, ChIP assay, qRT-PCR
Test setting: Mouse embryonic fibroblasts, NF639 cells, human epithelial tumour cells, human mesothelioma cells, xenograft mouse
Pathway: YAP :+: ACSL4, ACSL4 :+: Ferroptosis, YAP :+: TFRC,  TFRC :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Egl-9 family hypoxia inducible factor 2
Evidence: Inhibiting EGLN2 activation diminished ferroptotic tumor cell death.
Test method: Cytotoxicity assays, western blot, immunoprecipitation, RNA interference, gene transfection, qPCR, MDA assay
Test setting: Calu-1, THP1, HT1080, and HL-60 cells, athymic nude mice
Pathway: EGLN2 :-: HIF1A, HIF1A  :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Myo-inositol oxygenase
Evidence: Overexpression exacerbates cell death, knockdown inhibits ferroptosis.
Test method: MTT assay, measurement of GPX4 activity, labile iron pool assay, evaluation of cell death and cell morphology, immunohistochemical staining
Pathway: MIOX :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Ferroptosis, MIOX :-: GSH, GSH :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Tafazzin
Evidence: TAZ removal confers ferroptosis resistance, whereas overexpression of TAZS89A sensitizes cells to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability, cell death, western blot, siRNA, qRT-PCR, microarray, immunofluorescence staining, ChIP-seq, Lipid ROS assay
Pathway: TAZ :+: EMP1, EMP1 :+: NOX4, NOX4 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Metadherin
Evidence: Can enhance sensitivity to inducers of ferroptosis. Enhances the vulnerability of cancer cells to ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability, qRT-PCR, western blotting, GSH assay, GPx4 activity assay, tumor xenograft model
Test setting: Cell lines A549, H1975, DMS53, DMS273, KLE, AN3CA, RL95, Hec1A, Ishikawa, MDA-MB-231, MCF-7, Hec50, immunodeficient mice
Pathway: MTDH :-: Cysteine, Cystein :-: Ferroptosis, MTDH :-: SLC3A2, SLC3A2 :-: Ferroptosis, MTDH :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Ferroptosis, MTDH :-: GSH, GSH :-: Ferroptosis, MTDH :+: Glutamate, Glutamate :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Isocitrate dehydrogenase (NADP(+)) 1
Evidence: Deletion of the mutant IDH1 allele or pharmacological inhibition of mutant IDH1 confers resistance to erastin-induced ferroptosis. Ectopic expression of mutant IDH1 promotes ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell transfection, cell viability, GSH assay, lipid ROS assay
Pathway: IDH1 :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis, IDH1 :-: GSH, GSH :-: Ferroptosis

Name: Sirtuin 1
Evidence: Knockout partially mitigates ferroptosis.
Test method: Lipid peroxidation, iron and GSH assay, qRT-PCR, western blot

Name: Tafazzin
Evidence: TAZ removal confers ferroptosis resistance, while TAZS89A overexpression sensitizes cells to ferroptosis.
Test method: siRNA, qRT-PCR, western blot, cell viability, lipid ROS assay
Pathway: TAZ :+: ANGPTL4, ANGPTL4 :+: NOX2, NOX2 :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Beclin 1
Evidence: Overexpression aggravated isoflurane-induced cell damage by upregulating ferroptosis. This phenomenon was significantly attenuated by silencing of Beclin1.
Test method: Cell viability, RNAi, RT-qPCR, western blot, lipid peroxidation, iron, GSH and glutamate release assays

Name: F-box and WD repeat domain containing 7
Evidence: FBXW7 plasmid induces ferroptosis.
Test method: Cell viability, lipid peroxidation, iron, GSH and ROS assays, western blot, RT-PCR, RNA-seq

Name: Pannexin 1
Evidence: Deletion protects against ferroptotic cell death. Silenced Panx1 expression significantly attenuated ferroptotic lipid peroxidation and iron accumulation induced by the ferroptosis inducer erastin.
Test method: Cell viability, cell death, qRT-PCR, western blot, lipid peroxidation detection, shRNA
Pathway: PANX1 :-: HMOX1, HMOX1 :-: Ferroptosis, PANX1 :+: MAPK/ERK, MAPK/ERK :+: Ferroptinophagy, Ferroptinophagy :+: Ferroptosis

Name: DnaJ heat shock protein family (Hsp40) member B6
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
Test method: Western blot, immunohistochemistry,lentivirus infection, colony-forming, RT‑qPCR, CCK-8, transwell and mouse xenograft assays
Test setting: Cell lines TE-1, Eca9706, Eca109, KYSE150, and KYSE450, BALB/c athymic nude mice

Name: BTB domain and CNC homolog 1
Evidence: Promotes ferroptosis by repressing the transcription of a subset of the erastin-induced protective genes.
Test method: Western blotting, qPCR, cell death, labile iron detection, RNA-seq
Pathway: BACH1 :+: Lipid ROS, Lipid ROS :+: Ferroptosis

Name: Acyl-CoA synthetase long chain family member 4
Evidence: Overexpression induced ferroptosis. The opposite results were observed when ACSL4 was silenced.
Test method: Western blotting, immunofluorescence, 5‑HETE, LDH and CCK-8 cell viability assay
Test setting: HEB, T98G, U87 MG and U251 cells

Name: Lon peptidase 1, mitochondrial
Evidence: Inhibition of LONP1 negatively regulates erastin-induced cell death.
Test method: Cell viability, western blot, qRT-PCR, lipid peroxidation assay, glutathione assay
Pathway: LONP1 :-: Nrf2/Keap1 pathway, Nrf2/Keap1 pathway :-: Ferroptosis, LONP1 :-: GPX4, GPX4 :-: Ferroptosis
